text:
Manhattan Bridge: was begun October 1, 1901 and opened December 31, 1909. The total cost of land and construction being $31,084,705. Three views showing the tower.

September 7, 1908

P. L. Sperr

(3) Same, showing Hearst Enterprises Building in left foreground. June 5, 1932. P. L. Sperr.

About 1935.

Ewing Galloway.

text:
Manhattan Bridge: A view northward, showing the Manhattan Bridge, as seen from the Brooklyn Bridge. Forming a background is the skyline of Manhattan with its mammoth Empire Building. View is taken from midstream of the East River.

About 1936

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad A.R.P.S.

not a dry mount
title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge - [Brooklyn Bridge - Empire State Building.]

text:
Manhattan

Brooklyn Bridge: A view along the pedestrian walk on the Bridge. View 1 is an enlargement made by the photographer; view 2 being a copy of the original negative by the N.Y.P.L. About 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad A.R.P.S.

not a dry item

The Manhattan Bridge and its Brooklyn shore as photographed from South Street in Manhattan.

1939

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge - [Brooklyn shore.]

title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge - [East River.]

text:
One of Uncle Sam's Steel Warriors Departs for Winter Maneuvers
The U.S.S. Arkansas swings down the East River under the Manhattan Bridge on its way to the Carribean Sea to participate in the annual winter Maneuvers.
1930 International News Photo
title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge - [East River.]
